title: What's your favorite "Out of Meta" pick?
body:
Like the title says. What is your favorite "out of meta" pick? 

Role/champ? (or even build) 

I like playing a lot of out of meta picks for fun. Saw some post about Nami mid and that is one I like.

replies.body:
{{champion:91}} Jungle

It's what Amumu jungle would look like if his ult was on a 69 second cooldown.
How is talon's playstyle anything like amumus?

{{champion:63}} apc, he works just as well as any other ranged champ and his ult is better in bot lane
{{champion:58}} jg. high sustain if you use fury right and great ganks with mobility, stun, and armor shred to help kill top laners
{{champion:105}} apc (need a good duo partner) get anyone with a nice stun to support you (morgana for example) and fizz wins bottom lane against any adc every time 
{{champion:150}} support. Haven't used him myslef but have played against it and its annoying as hell
{{champion:29}} top. or any adc top. Often fares well against the mostly-melee tank meta you see top, just keep your distance
You... You know APC means Ability Power Carry, not Ability Power Bot Lane, right? lol. APC is still a term used today to describe bursty mid laners. lol
I've played Kalista mid, does that count?
ADC {{champion:4}}

If you like that, i've got a friend who plays TF jungle. It looks so much fun, and he always does well.

Here's his op.gg if you care: http://euw.op.gg/summoner/userName=Nutty%20Boiz
Top tank {{champion:44}} , so outrageous
Truly Truly, outrageous.
Truly truly TRULY Outrageous...
{{champion:78}}

I love mid Nami. Depending on the matchup, I'll usually go {{item:3027}} , {{item:3116}} , {{item:3151}} , {{item:3089}} , {{item:3285}} with {{item:3020}} of course. Rylai's is an underrated but fantastic item on her, since her W bounces between allies and enemies. It speeds up every ally it hits and slows every enemy with this item. And with Liandry, they're going to be losing chunks every time. You also have a ton of HP with this build so you're a bit harder to kill than the average fish. Make sure to Max Q first you'll need it for waveclear.

Honorable mention items
{{item:3100}} , {{item:3115}}  works great with her E.

Nami mid works best if you have a jungler who will gank for you a lot. You can almost guarantee a kill every time they gank for you if you're good at landing bubbles. Someone like Udyr is ideal, he can run in, and you make him run faster with E. Then you bubble them, he stuns them, and that's all she wrote. And you can send him back into the jungle with a nice W heal. Hope someone found this interesting/helpful!
ad {{champion:90}}  jng is fun when i get the chance to play it! really enjoyable watchin the voidlings do the dirty work for me.

{{champion:143}} jungle, first clear is tough but after that your plants tank for you (but raptors still suck)
Snare, slow and a knock-up, anything you gank dies

{{champion:3}} support: {{item:2049}} {{item:3047}}  {{item:3110}}  {{item:3001}}  {{item:3105}} {{item:3065}}
derp forgot {{item:3097}}
{{champion:83}}  anywhere, because lets face it wherever you play him someone will call you a troll and tell you he sucks. Until you go 12/3/15 and shut them up.
{{champion:36}} Jungle

it does make sense, he goes where he pleases...

i'll show myself out

{{champion:83}} support back in season 4 when it was mainly assasin's
is a huge cockblock against hook champions like blitz/tresh/naut with a well placed ghoul (usually W)
outpokes poke botlanes
and outheals healing lanes. granted that you will need some mana pots.

however now that the tank/juggernaut meta is a thing it simply isn't very viable.

I play Top ad {{champion:16}}  Topraka for short. If done correctly you can force what the enemy thinks is going to be an easy 20 min victory into an unexpected banana fest going up to 60 minutes long. Seriously, every time I play soraka the game becomes so long because I carry so hard the rest of my team can't surrender.
But it's still a 60 minute loss.

Soraka does well versus most mages due to having vastly superior sustain and an AoE silence, but playing her mid is risky because she dies hard to assassins. If you try to take her top, she probably won't *lose* lane to the bruisers, but she sure as hell isn't going to win it.

So you'll generally roll into the endgame, at which point you have a team with two supports. That isn't necessarily a loss, but it's not a recipe for success, either.

Full AD Critmacia mid
http://img13.deviantart.net/3bba/i/2010/298/e/f/demacia_by_enciferart-d31hw80.jpg

I've played around 15 games of {{champion:4}} jungle and lost about 4. Before the nerfs to devoured it kicked unbelievable amounts of ass, now you have to build much more AD before being effective and it's synergy with devourer is pretty meh. It's still decently strong.

build was {{item:3933}} {{item:3153}}  {{item:3091}}  {{item:3006}}  any defensive item or {{item:3046}}  if you're rolling, then either {{item:3031}}  or {{item:3072}}  depending on if you need more survivability or damage. Get the ie if you went pd always

I'd gotten flamed in champ select and the kids shut the hell up when I get a quadra kill lol



If I could actually compare him to Kindred for a second as a marksman jungler, I'd say he's better. Obviously not if kindred has absurd stacks , but his farming speed is SO much faster once you can actually clear, you farm about as fast as a master yi. Plus TF has really strong ganks with R and W compared to kindred with just E which is kinda meh. Sucks they had to nerf devourer for her and kick TF jungle in jungle in the balls
{{champion:4}} adc. Works surprising well against Vayne. If she ults, you ult so you can see her while she is invisible. Then slap her with a gold card and boom, free kill.

{{champion:121}} top and mid

{{champion:105}} AD top (and jungle with Devourer, but I only use it when I am forced to go jungle)

{{champion:9}} support

{{champion:154}} top

{{champion:30}} 

{{champion:83}}

(I've included both Karthus and Yorick because while I play them at their common roles of mid and top laner respectively, they are very rarely played, so they are both out of meta.

{{champion:21}} Mage Fortune Bot

{{champion:39}} Jungler

i used to do {{champion:114}}  jungler but rito screwed up her passive and her q...Wait i mean reworked

Sated {{champion:39}} is tons of fun. With _tons of damage_ 

{{champion:133}} JG i also a fun one.
i know that twitch jungler is a thing but quinn? IMA TRY IT OUT in ranked game...jk bots ftw

{{champion:39}} JG is great. Devourer, Wit's End, BotRK, Boots, Spirit Visage, and Randuin's makes you into a high-damage bruiser or tanky assassin who shreds through all but the tankiest of targets with ease.
J4 support played that since season 3 cc qe.  E gives adc attackspeed.  Ultimately saves peeps,.

{{champion:31}} JG, and Supp
{{champion:37}} I've taken her everywhere but ADC
{{champion:134}} Supp
{{champion:45}} Supp
{{champion:115}} Supp
{{champion:412}} ADC and Mid
{{champion:16}} I'm famous for my ADC Soraka
{{champion:114}} I played her supp once.
{{champion:86}} Supp
{{champion:57}} Supp
{{champion:54}} Supp (with a Yas ADC)
{{champion:1}} Supp and Mid

{{champion:223}} Jg, Mid, Top, Supp, and ADC (can you tell i main supp?)
{{champion:4}} ADC

My favorite oddball support so far has probably been {{champion:27}}. It's pretty nuts.

I was looking into Syndra support back before her E width nerfs. How well does she work as a support nowadays?

> [{quoted}](name=freeformline,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WJFmrAFx,comment-id=00840001,timestamp=2015-10-22T18:01:56.896+0000)
>
> My favorite oddball support so far has probably been {{champion:27}}. It's pretty nuts.
> 
> I was looking into Syndra support back before her E width nerfs. How well does she work as a support nowadays?

She's a support kinda like how Zyra is. Good CC and poke if you can hit skill shots. She's not a completely ideal support, and I can see why many people choose supports like Lulu or Sona over her because of her lack of direct supportyness. I would play her mid first before supporting with her, as you'll learn her combos easier that way. Without proper comboing in bot lane, the CC and poke synergy is very  unreliable. Oh, and just a warning, her early mana costs are absolutely terrible.

> [{quoted}](name=TheSavvyBuffalo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WJFmrAFx,comment-id=0084,timestamp=2015-10-22T13:43:24.074+0000)

I main supp too. I love taking off meta supp.

{{champion:34}} support

It's pretty heavy cheese, if you land the q you can burst with your adc, if you can't you're kind of useless until 6.

*farms in jungle all game till 30:00 with a complete build* 

"Hello, I'm ad Veigar and I'll be your surprise killer today"
{{champion:27}}
I play a lot of {{champion:50}}  and I've recently started playing {{champion:3}} support.  {{champion:3}}  + {{champion:429}}  bot lane is bonkers.

I recently discovered that AP Lucian is actually not complete garbage and can be a ton of fun.

If you want something really trolling, try an On-Hit/Atk. Speed build for Bard. If you farm a ton of Charms the combination of his upgraded autos along with things like Wit's End and Frozen Mallet can be hilarious.
I play ad janna top {{champion:40}} with her e and bf sword people are never prepared for how much she hurts. I get so many kills by taking people by surprise.
I thoroughly enjoy either {{champion:63}} or{{champion:154}} support. It's so fun to just jump around doing some weird shit on Zac and to play support {{item:3116}}  Brand
Upvoted for quinn top cause I've been trying to make it work for the longest time but couldn't figure out a good build
